member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator
member.summary: Generates Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instructions.
member.remarks: A typical use of the ILGenerator class is to produce the values of the properties of an IMethodBody object. This could be a SourceMethodBody from the mutable Code Model or an instance of ILGeneratorMethodBody (or perhaps a derived class). In the former case, the ILGenerator is a part of the private state of an instance of CodeModelToILConverter (or a derived class) that is usually part of a code model mutator. In the latter case, the ILGenerator may have been used to generate a method body for which no Code Model has been built.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataHost,Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition)
member.summary: Allocates an object that helps with the generation of Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instructions corresponding to a method body.
member.param: Provides a standard abstraction over the applications that host components that provide or consume objects from the metadata model.
The method to generate MSIL for.
The async method for which this generator will generate the "MoveNext" method of its state class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.AddConstantToCurrentScope(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalDefinition)
member.summary: Adds the given local constant to the current lexical scope.
member.param: The local constant to add to the current scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.AddVariableToCurrentScope(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalDefinition)
member.summary: Adds the given local variable to the current lexical scope.
member.param: The local variable to add to the current scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.AddExceptionHandlerInformation(Microsoft.Cci.HandlerKind,Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference,Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorLabel,Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorLabel,Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorLabel,Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorLabel,Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorLabel)
member.summary: Adds an exception handler entry to the generated body. This intended for IL rewriting scenarios and should not be used in conjunction with methods such as BeginCatchBlock, which are intended for CodeModel to IL generation scenarios. The calls to AddExceptionHandler should result in a list of handlers that satisfies CLI rules with respect to ordering and nesting.
member.param: The kind of handler being added.
The type of exception this handler will handle (may be Dummy.TypeReference).
A label identifying the first instruction in the try body.
A label identifying the first instruction following the try body.
A label identifying the first instruction in the handler body.
A label identifying the first instruction following the handler body.
A label identifying the first instruction of the filter decision block. May be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.AdjustBranchSizesToBestFit(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs one or more extra passes over the list of operations, changing long branches to short if possible and short branches to long branches if necessary.
member.remarks: If any long branches in this.operations could have been short, they are adjusted to be short. This can result in an updated version of this.operations where some branches that had to be long in the previous version can now be short as well. Consequently, the adjustment process iterates until no further changes are possible. Note that all decisions are made based on the offsets at the start of an iteration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.BeginCatchBlock(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Begins a catch block.
member.param: The Type object that represents the exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.BeginFilterBlock
member.summary: Begins an exception block for a filtered exception. See also BeginFilterBody.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.BeginFilterBody
member.summary: Begins the part of a filter handler that is invoked on the second pass if the filter condition returns true on the first pass.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.BeginTryBody
member.summary: Begins the body of a try statement.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.BeginFaultBlock
member.summary: Begins an exception fault block in the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.BeginFinallyBlock
member.summary: Begins a finally block in the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction stream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.BeginScope
member.summary: Begins a lexical scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.BeginScope(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Begins a lexical scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode)
member.summary: Puts the specified instruction onto the stream of instructions.
member.param: The Intermediate Language (IL) instruction to be put onto the stream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,System.Object)
member.summary: Calls a type specific overload of Emit, based on the runtime type of the given object. Use this when copying IL operations.
member.param: The Intermediate Language (IL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
An argument that parameterizes the IL instruction at compile time (not a runtime operand for the instruction).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,System.Byte)
member.summary: Puts the specified instruction and unsigned 8 bit integer argument onto the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream of instructions.
member.param: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
The unsigned 8 bit integer argument pushed onto the stream immediately after the instruction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,System.Double)
member.summary: Puts the specified instruction and 64 bit floating point argument onto the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream of instructions.
member.param: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
The 64 bit floating point argument pushed onto the stream immediately after the instruction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,Microsoft.Cci.IFieldReference)
member.summary: Puts the specified instruction and a field reference onto the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream of instructions.
member.param: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
A reference to a field.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,System.Single)
member.summary: Puts the specified instruction and 32 bit floating point argument onto the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream of instructions.
member.param: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
The 32 bit floating point argument pushed onto the stream immediately after the instruction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Puts the specified instruction and 32 bit integer argument onto the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream of instructions.
member.param: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
The 32 bit integer argument pushed onto the stream immediately after the instruction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorLabel)
member.summary: Puts the specified instruction onto the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream and leaves space to include a label when fixes are done.
member.param: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
The label to which to branch from this location.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorLabel[])
member.summary: Puts the specified instruction onto the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream and leaves space to include an array of labels when fixes are done.
member.param: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
An array of labels to which to branch from this location.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,Microsoft.Cci.ILocalDefinition)
member.summary: Puts the specified instruction onto the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream followed by the index of the given local variable.
member.param: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
A local variable.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,System.Int64)
member.summary: Puts the specified instruction and 64 bit integer argument onto the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream of instructions.
member.param: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
The 64 bit integer argument pushed onto the stream immediately after the instruction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,Microsoft.Cci.IMethodReference)
member.summary: Puts the specified instruction onto the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream followed by a token for the given method reference.
member.param: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
A reference to a method. Generic methods can only be referenced via instances.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,Microsoft.Cci.IParameterDefinition)
member.summary: Puts the specified instruction onto the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream followed by the index of the given local variable.
member.param: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
A parameter definition. May be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,System.SByte)
member.summary: Puts the specified instruction and signed 8 bit integer argument onto the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream of instructions.
member.param: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
The signed 8 bit integer argument pushed onto the stream immediately after the instruction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,System.Int16)
member.summary: Puts the specified instruction and signed 16 bit integer argument onto the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream of instructions.
member.param: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
The signed 8 bit integer argument pushed onto the stream immediately after the instruction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,Microsoft.Cci.ISignature)
member.summary: Puts the specified instruction and a token for the given signature onto the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream of instructions.
member.param: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
The signature of the method or function pointer to call. Can include information about extra arguments.

member.summary: Puts the specified instruction onto the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream followed by the a token for the given string.
member.param: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
The String to be emitted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Emit(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Puts the specified instruction onto the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream followed by the a token for the referenced type.
member.param: The Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction to be put onto the stream.
The referenced type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.EndTryBody
member.summary: Ends a try body.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.EndScope
member.summary: Ends a lexical scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.MarkExpressionLocation(Microsoft.Cci.ILocation)
member.summary: Marks the next IL operation as the final instruction of an expression, whose location is known and is provided as the argument.
member.param: The location of the expression whose value will be computed by the next IL instruction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.MarkLabel(Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorLabel)
member.summary: Marks the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream's current position with the given label.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.MarkSequencePoint(Microsoft.Cci.ILocation)
member.summary: Marks a sequence point in the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) stream.
member.param: The location of the sequence point.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.MarkSynchronizationPoint(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorLabel)
member.summary: Marks the offset of the next IL operation as the first of a sequence of instructions that will cause the thread executing the "MoveNext" method of the state class of an async method to await the completion of a call to another async method.
member.param: The helper method that will execute once the execution of the current async method resumes. Usually this will be the same method as the one for which this generator is generating a body, but this is not required.
The label inside the continuation method where execution will resume. It should be marked by the time this generator is being used to construct a method body.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.LongVersionOf(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode)
member.summary: If the given operation code is a short branch, return the corresponding long branch. Otherwise return the given operation code.
member.param: An operation code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.ShortVersionOf(Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode)
member.summary: If the given operation code is a long branch, return the corresponding short branch. Otherwise return the given operation code.
member.param: An operation code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.UseNamespace(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies a namespace to be search when evaluating expressions while stopped in the debugger at a sequence point in the current lexical scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.GetIteratorScopes
member.summary: Returns a block scope associated with each local variable in the iterator for which this is the generator for its MoveNext method. May return null.
member.remarks: The PDB file model seems to be that scopes are duplicated if necessary so that there is a separate scope for each local variable in the original iterator and the mapping from local to scope is done by position.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.GetLocalScopes
member.summary: Returns a sequence of all of the block scopes that have been defined for this method body. Includes nested block scopes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.GetNamespaceScopes
member.summary: Returns zero or more namespace scopes into which the namespace type containing the given method body has been nested. These scopes determine how simple names are looked up inside the method body. There is a separate scope for each dotted component in the namespace type name. For istance namespace type x.y.z will have two namespace scopes, the first is for the x and the second is for the y.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.GetOperations
member.summary: Returns a sequence of all of the IL operations that make up this method body.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.GetOperationExceptionInformation
member.summary: Returns a sequence of descriptors that define where try blocks and their associated handlers can be found in the instruction sequence.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.GetSynchronizationInformation
member.summary: Returns an object that describes where synchronization points occur in the IL operations of the "MoveNext" method of the state class of an asynchronous method. This returns null unless the generator has been supplied with an non null value for asyncMethodDefinition parameter during construction.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.CurrentOffset
member.summary: The offset in the IL stream where the next instruction will be emitted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.InTryBody
member.summary: True if the ILGenerator is currently inside the body of a try statement.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.Method
member.summary: The method for which this generator helps to produce a method body.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.LocalScopeProvider
member.summary: An object that can provide information about the local scopes of a method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.LocalScopeProvider.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScopeProvider)
member.summary: An object that can provide information about the local scopes of a method.
member.param: The local scope provider to use for methods that have not been decompiled.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.LocalScopeProvider.GetIteratorScopes(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Returns zero or more local (block) scopes, each defining an IL range in which an iterator local is defined. The scopes are returned by the MoveNext method of the object returned by the iterator method. The index of the scope corresponds to the index of the local. Specifically local scope i corresponds to the local stored in field <localName>x_i of the class used to store the local values in between calls to MoveNext.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.LocalScopeProvider.GetLocalScopes(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Returns zero or more local (block) scopes into which the CLR IL operations in the given method body is organized.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.LocalScopeProvider.GetNamespaceScopes(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Returns zero or more namespace scopes into which the namespace type containing the given method body has been nested. These scopes determine how simple names are looked up inside the method body. There is a separate scope for each dotted component in the namespace type name. For istance namespace type x.y.z will have two namespace scopes, the first is for the x and the second is for the y.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.LocalScopeProvider.GetConstantsInScope(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScope)
member.summary: Returns zero or more local constant definitions that are local to the given scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.LocalScopeProvider.GetVariablesInScope(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScope)
member.summary: Returns zero or more local variable definitions that are local to the given scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.LocalScopeProvider.IsIterator(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Returns true if the method body is an iterator.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator.LocalScopeProvider.GetSynchronizationInformation(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: If the given method body is the "MoveNext" method of the state class of an asynchronous method, the returned object describes where synchronization points occur in the IL operations of the "MoveNext" method. Otherwise the result is null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorLabel
member.summary: An object that is used to mark a location in an IL stream and that is used to indicate where branches go to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorLabel.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an object that is used to mark a location in an IL stream and that is used to indicate where branches go to.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorLabel.locationOfReturnInstruction
member.summary: Non-null only when labelsReturnInstruction is true.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.GeneratorLocal
member.summary: A mutable object that represents a local variable or constant.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.GeneratorLocal.#ctor
member.summary: Allocates a mutable object that represents a local variable or constant.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.GeneratorLocal.CompileTimeValue
member.summary: The compile time value of the definition, if it is a local constant.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.GeneratorLocal.CustomModifiers
member.summary: Custom modifiers associated with local variable definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.GeneratorLocal.IsCompilerGenerated
member.summary: True if the local is a temporary variable generated by the compiler and thus does not have a corresponding source declaration.
member.remarks: The Visual Studio debugger will hide the existance of compiler generated locals.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.GeneratorLocal.IsConstant
member.summary: True if this local definition is readonly and initialized with a compile time constant value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.GeneratorLocal.IsModified
member.summary: The local variable has custom modifiers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.GeneratorLocal.IsPinned
member.summary: True if the value referenced by the local must not be moved by the actions of the garbage collector.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.GeneratorLocal.IsReference
member.summary: True if the local contains a managed pointer (for example a reference to a local variable or a reference to a field of an object).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.GeneratorLocal.Name
member.summary: The name of the entity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.GeneratorLocal.Locations
member.summary: A potentially empty collection of locations that correspond to this instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.GeneratorLocal.MethodDefinition
member.summary: The definition of the method in which this local is defined.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.GeneratorLocal.Type
member.summary: The type of the local.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorScope
member.summary: An object that keeps track of a set of local definitions (variables) and used (imported) namespaces that appear in the source code corresponding to the IL operations from Offset to Offset+Length.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorScope.Constants
member.summary: The local definitions (constants) defined in the source code corresponding to this scope.(A debugger can use this when evaluating expressions in a program point that falls inside this scope.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorScope.Length
member.summary: The length of the scope. Offset+Length equals the offset of the first operation outside the scope, or equals the method body length.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorScope.Locals
member.summary: The local definitions (variables) defined in the source code corresponding to this scope.(A debugger can use this when evaluating expressions in a program point that falls inside this scope.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorScope.MethodDefinition
member.summary: The method definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorScope.Offset
member.summary: The offset of the first operation in the scope.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorScope.UsedNamespaceNames
member.summary: The namespaces that are used (imported) into this scope. (A debugger can use this when evaluating expressions in a program point that falls inside this scope.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorScope.UsedNamespaces
member.summary: Zero or more used namespaces. These correspond to using clauses in C#.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorImplementation.UsedNamespace
member.summary: A namespace that is used (imported) inside a namespace scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorImplementation.UsedNamespace.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IName)
member.summary: Allocates a namespace that is used (imported) inside a namespace scope.
member.param: The name of a namepace that has been aliased. For example the "y.z" of "using x = y.z;" or "using y.z" in C#.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorImplementation.UsedNamespace.Alias
member.summary: An alias for a namespace. For example the "x" of "using x = y.z;" in C#. Empty if no alias is present.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorImplementation.UsedNamespace.NamespaceName
member.summary: The name of a namepace that has been aliased. For example the "y.z" of "using x = y.z;" or "using y.z" in C#.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorMethodBody
member.summary: A metadata (IL) level represetation of the body of a method or of a property/event accessor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorMethodBody.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.ILGenerator,System.Boolean,System.UInt16,Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.ILocalDefinition},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition})
member.summary: Allocates an object that is the metadata (IL) level represetation of the body of a method or of a property/event accessor.
member.param: An object that provides a way to construct the information needed by a method body. Construction should be completed by the time the generator is passed to this constructor. The generator is not referenced by the resulting method body.
True if the locals are initialized by zeroeing the stack upon method entry.
The maximum number of elements on the evaluation stack during the execution of the method.
The definition of the method whose body this is. If this is the body of an event or property accessor, this will hold the corresponding adder/remover/setter or getter method.

Any types that are implicitly defined in order to implement the body semantics. In case of AST to instructions conversion this lists the types produced. In case of instructions to AST decompilation this should ideally be list of all types which are local to method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorMethodBody.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls visitor.Visit(IMethodBody).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorMethodBody.GetIteratorScopes
member.summary: Returns a block scope associated with each local variable in the iterator for which this is the generator for its MoveNext method. May return null.
member.remarks: The PDB file model seems to be that scopes are duplicated if necessary so that there is a separate scope for each local variable in the original iterator and the mapping from local to scope is done by position.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorMethodBody.GetLocalScopes
member.summary: Returns zero or more local (block) scopes into which the CLR IL operations of this method body is organized.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorMethodBody.GetNamespaceScopes
member.summary: Returns zero or more namespace scopes into which the namespace type containing the given method body has been nested. These scopes determine how simple names are looked up inside the method body. There is a separate scope for each dotted component in the namespace type name. For istance namespace type x.y.z will have two namespace scopes, the first is for the x and the second is for the y.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorMethodBody.GetSynchronizationInformation
member.summary: Returns an object that describes where synchronization points occur in the IL operations of the "MoveNext" method of the state class of an async method. Returns null otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorMethodBody.OperationExceptionInformation
member.summary: A list exception data within the method body IL.

ensures.csharp: for all x in result x != null
ensures.vb: for all x in result x <> Nothing

getter.ensures: for all x in result x != null

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorMethodBody.LocalsAreZeroed
member.summary: True if the locals are initialized by zeroeing the stack upon method entry.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorMethodBody.LocalVariables
member.summary: The local variables of the method.

ensures.csharp: for all x in result x != null
ensures.vb: for all x in result x <> Nothing

getter.ensures: for all x in result x != null

member.summary: The definition of the method whose body this is. If this is the body of an event or property accessor, this will hold the corresponding adder/remover/setter or getter method.

member.summary: A list CLR IL operations that implement this method body.

ensures.csharp: for all x in result x != null
ensures.vb: for all x in result x <> Nothing

getter.ensures: for all x in result x != null

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorMethodBody.MaxStack
member.summary: The maximum number of elements on the evaluation stack during the execution of the method.

member.summary: Any types that are implicitly defined in order to implement the body semantics. In case of AST to instructions conversion this lists the types produced. In case of instructions to AST decompilation this should ideally be list of all types which are local to method.

ensures.csharp: for all x in result x != null
ensures.vb: for all x in result x <> Nothing

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorSourceInformationProvider.GetPrimarySourceLocationsFor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.ILocation})
member.summary: Return zero or more locations in primary source documents that correspond to one or more of the given derived (non primary) document locations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorSourceInformationProvider.GetPrimarySourceLocationsFor(Microsoft.Cci.ILocation)
member.summary: Return zero or more locations in primary source documents that correspond to the given derived (non primary) document location.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorSourceInformationProvider.GetPrimarySourceLocationsForDefinitionOf(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalDefinition)
member.summary: Return zero or more locations in primary source documents that correspond to the definition of the given local.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILGeneratorSourceInformationProvider.GetSourceNameFor(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalDefinition,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Returns the source name of the given local definition, if this is available. Otherwise returns the value of the Name property and sets isCompilerGenerated to true.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILRewriter
member.summary: Rewrites the IL of method bodies.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILRewriter.EmitOperation(Microsoft.Cci.IOperation)
member.summary: Emits the given operation at the current position of the new IL stream. Also tracks any referenced local definitions, so that this.localVariables will contain the exact list of locals used in the new method body.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILRewriter.GetLabelFor(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns a label that represents the given offset in the original IL. This label must be marked at the corresponding location in the rewritten IL.
